meanings.definition: To rise or float in the air without any physical support.
meanings.sent1: The magician levitates above the stage during the magic show.
meanings.sent2: The balloon slowly levitates into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to levitate after seeing a bird fly.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness levitates her spirits to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's ability to levitate made him unstoppable in battle.

meanings.definition: To cause to rise or float in the air without any physical support.
meanings.sent1: She used her mind to levitate the objects in the room.
meanings.sent2: The wizard levitates the stone effortlessly with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy decided to levitate her friend's hat just for fun.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to levitate her mood from sadness to joy.
meanings.sent5: The music had a magical quality that seemed to levitate the listeners into another world.
